title: @RIOT Why does a visual UPDATE mean "we're deleting the champion you like, and replacing them"?
body:
Fiora and Gangplank are dead, gone, and have been replaced by strangers who I don't want to allow into my home. Where are their old voices? Where are their old faces? Why can't you just update them without turning them into an entirely new person? The people I've spent years laning against are gone.

Why? Why not do a simple update like you did with Katarina and Ashe? What about people who are attached to the champions whose looks you are **deleting**?

https://www.linkedin.com/grp/post/3544410-6028578303231668227

"Nearly all the lines start high and end down. The rhythm of each line is punched almost exactly the same every time"

The new VO is lower quality.

For the change they're doing, I'd argue that the new VO is much better. Old GP's VO was never bad, but it seems too... jolly, overall. Like Pirate Mcpirate guy. The new voice, to me atleast, conveys a much deeper sense of seriousness. This is a guy who WILL pillage and plunder, not just someone who only talks about it.

I'm not a voice acting expert by any means, but after reading "starts high/ends low" I can't unhear it. It probably won't be as bad in-game since you're not going to be listening to him saying lines nonstop, but I bet that Johnson guy could've helped them do it better.

I wouldn't really say they "deleted" him. They more or less just re-imagined a character who, quite frankly, didn't really have much to him other then some cliche pirate lines and orange memes. Although I may sometimes miss the old "YARR HARR" gusto of the original Gangplank, the new one instills a sense of fear and cunning that really makes a pirate a pirate to me. 

Maybe I'm just optimistic, but I can't really see anything wrong with reworking old champs, I haven't disliked a single one yet. Its new, exciting, and exactly what keeps me coming back to league time and time again.

It's like with Sion. Hey, some people liked the old goofy Sion, and there was whining when he changed, but does it mean it was a bad idea? Why isn't Sion up at the top of this thread? Or Tristana? Are they too obvious of rework examples where Riot went right?

I like new GP. I like new Fiora. Things have changed that made them iconic, but I think overall their characters ended up more defined. He lost his "YARR HARR" gusto and she lost her "OMG HAWT" face (and they'll probably have to turn down the shine what with all this crappy feedback) but in the end we're just going to accept it anyway.

You're literally arguing that changing her appearance has improved her personality, lol.

In what way is making her less attractive, apparently, giving her more personality?

In what way does it harm her personality?

From the clothing and design perspective, I think the flashier look fits her "slightly arrogant yet refined" theme and the whole idea of being a high class world renowned fencer. I mean, nobody fences on the battlefield. It's not like the heavy armor was a necessity for her thematics wise. She looks sleeker and more refined in that suit, which fits her character rather well.
I also like the hair. Was the emo hair with the red streak a necessity to her character? No. That would just obscure her vision and depth perception in a match, which is counter intuitive.
People want to keep the hair and the armor, but there's no justification other than "I like it". Sometimes that's all you need, but know that there are still people who like her new look better and have their own opinion which isn't worth any less than yours.
I'm not going to touch on her face. It doesn't exactly matter and you're free to think what you want about character attractiveness.
I'd say her fencer theme and character have been more defined by the visual update. Also, this is my biased opinion, but I think the new face suits her better as a somewhat snooty French fencer. It doesn't detract from anything other than sex appeal and the nostalgia effect, so why not try to accentuate her character through a makeover?

Actually I'd say it is, and I will tell you why.

These people would have lost no sleep if literally nothing about Fiora's appearance changed. 

Meanwhile, people who actually liked the old splash art and vastly prefer it to this one and just generally don't identify it as being Fiora anymore, if this changed goes through, are being told to shove off and deal with it. 

A wise man once said that if you want to make a baby cry, you give them a lollipop before taking it away. Because you see, if a baby never had a lollipop to begin with, there's nothing to cry about. But if you take one away from it, the tears come pouring. You see it's our tears Stan, that give Riot its great power (this is a South Park reference, if you think I'm being totally serious).

> I'm not going to touch on her face. It doesn't exactly matter and you're free to think what you want about character attractiveness.

The people who liked her old design, maybe?

You make a lot of good points that have changed the way I think about this rework. I'll still enjoy it whether it gets changed or not, but I can understand your feelings now.  I'm just really tired of people getting overly aggressive and whiny about Fiora, both mechanics and visuals, and I probably got a little defensive of her new design when I didn't need to.
Thanks for taking the time to explain it to me :)
